content: Write a sonnet about dolphins using only words that start with 'd'.

Delicate dolphins dart deep in dark depths,
Dancing, displaying dexterity and delight.
Dazzling divers, they dive, daring death,
Defying danger, with divine delight.

Dreamy dorsal fins, depicting delicate designs,
Directing their descent, with determined drive.
Devoted to their domains, deep and divine,
They dominate the depths, with divine pride.

Dynamic duets, they dance in the deep,
Displaying devotion, to their dear ones.
Defending their young, with dedicated zeal,
They deter danger, with determined stunts.

Thus, dolphins dwell in the deep, dark sea,
Demonstrating dignity, in their domain, eternally.
